item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "History doesn't repeat itself, but it does rhyme." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You know what charm is: a way of getting the answer yes without having asked any clear question." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Did you ever stop to think, and forget to start again?" -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "Seize the moment. Remember all those women on the 'Titanic' who waved off the dessert cart." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "The thought of two thousand people crunching celery at the same time horrified me." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Calvin Trillin
item.description: "The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found." -- Calvin Trillin

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Christopher Morley
item.description: "No man is lonely while eating spaghetti: it requires so much attention." -- Christopher Morley

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "There is one thing more exasperating than a wife who can cook and won't, and that's a wife who can't cook and will." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Alyssa add a quote by Frederic Raphael
item.description: "Great restaurants are, of course, nothing but mouth-brothels. There is no point in going to them if one intends to keep one's belt buckled." -- Frederic Raphael
